decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful spells that can quickly build a board presence. By utilizing cards like Lovestruck Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, and Clarion Spirit, the deck aims to maintain a strong early game advantage while generating card advantage through Edgewall Innkeeper. The inclusion of powerful cards like Felidar Retreat and Showdown of the Skalds allows for explosive late-game plays to finish off the opponent. The use of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an additional layer of consistency to the deck.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on putting constant pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures and powerful finishers. By playing cards like Magda, Brazen Outlaw and Jaspera Sentinel early on, the deck aims to build a board presence quickly. This is supported by cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast to continue the aggression. Goldspan Dragon and Embercleave serve as strong threats to close out the game. The deck also includes some card advantage engines like Edgewall Innkeeper to keep up the pressure. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing control spells and removal to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The main win condition is to establish a dominant board presence through powerful threats like Vorinclex, Polukranos, Koma, and Elder Gargaroth while controlling the game with counterspells, removal, and enchantments like Binding the Old Gods. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a versatile companion that can reset the board and provide incremental advantage. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage and overwhelming them with powerful creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures and utilizing the synergy between creatures and spells to deal damage efficiently. With the help of the companion card Obosh, the Preypiercer, the deck aims to maximize damage output by only including odd converted mana cost cards. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Goldspan Dragon and Elder Gargaroth, along with disruptive spells like Mystical Dispute, allows the deck to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent in a 1 vs 1 match. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure smooth mana curve progression.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent through aggressive creature plays and combat tricks. Utilizing cards like Reidane, God of the Worthy and Venerable Warsinger to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently deploying threats like Bonecrusher Giant and Luminarch Aspirant. Showdown of the Skalds provides card advantage and boosts the power of the team, leading to fast and efficient victories by overwhelming the opponent with relentless attacks.

The Sultai Control deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful card advantage engines. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents by efficiently answering threats and generating card advantage with cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Omen of the Sea. The deck also utilizes powerful finishers like Alrund's Epiphany and Kiora Bests the Sea God to close out games once it has stabilized. With a versatile suite of answers and threats, the Sultai Control deck is able to adapt to a wide range of matchups and strategies.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and ramping into powerful late-game threats. By including Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck aims to maximize its value by blinking powerful permanents. The deck includes a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and board wipes to control the battlefield, along with ramp spells like Cultivate and Emergent Ultimatum to ensure it can cast its high-cost spells. The end game plan involves resolving powerful threats like Valki, God of Lies and Emergent Ultimatum to overwhelm the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly get creatures on the board and attack aggressively with Winota, Joiner of Forces to trigger her ability and put even more pressure on the opponent. Cards like Showdown of the Skalds and Embercleave help boost the power of your creatures and finish off the opponent quickly. The deck focuses on synergy between creatures like Alpine Watchdog, Bolt Hound, and Alpine Houndmaster to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of attackers. Including key cards like Selfless Savior and Pack Leader helps protect your creatures and maintain board presence.

This deck focuses on utilizing cycling cards to quickly fill the graveyard and trigger effects that deal damage to the opponent or create tokens. By cycling through your deck efficiently, you can build up your resources and overwhelm your opponent with a combination of direct damage and aggressive creatures. With a mix of cycling creatures, spells, and lands, you can maintain a fast pace and constantly pressure your opponent to keep up with your aggressive plays.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, capitalizing on the synergy between cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Anax, Hardened in the Forge to maximize damage output. With a mix of efficient creatures and powerful combat tricks like Embercleave, the deck aims to close out the game as quickly as possible by relentlessly attacking and dealing damage. The inclusion of snow lands allows for additional flexibility and resource management throughout the game.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on using counterspells, removal, card draw, and big finishers like Alrund's Epiphany and Shark Typhoon to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck also utilizes Titans' Nest to help generate additional card advantage and Mana efficiency. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion allows for additional value and synergy with the deck's creature base. The mana base is built to support the deck's three-color requirements while maximizing consistency. The overall strategy is to control the board and win through powerful late-game threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to control the board and outvalue the opponent. With Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck aims to take advantage of the extra flicker effect for additional value. The deck also includes various versatile threats like Ashiok, Nightmare Muse and Polukranos, Unchained to apply pressure on the opponent. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure smooth and consistent mana access for casting spells across all colors.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through various removal spells and counterspells while ramping up to powerful late-game threats. It utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for additional value and consistency. The deck includes a variety of powerful spells and creatures with different abilities to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By efficiently managing resources and utilizing the synergy between cards, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long game.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and resources through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. It also aims to ramp up mana quickly to cast powerful spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value and card advantage through blinking permanents. The deck utilizes a mix of creatures, enchantments, and lands to stabilize the board while setting up for game-winning plays with its powerful spells and abilities, taking advantage of the Sultai color combination's strengths.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with aggressive creatures, using cards like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant to apply pressure, while also utilizing cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to generate card advantage. This deck aims to control the board with cards like Brazen Borrower and Fire Prophecy, while also having options like Prismari Command and Disdainful Stroke to disrupt opponent's plans. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Koma, Cosmos Serpent to close out the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board of small, aggressive white creatures to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes disruptive creatures like Drannith Magistrate and Elite Spellbinder to control the opponent's resources and prevent them from casting key spells. The deck's creatures also have protection and ways to protect each other, ensuring they can continue to apply pressure. Lastly, Maul of the Skyclaves and Faceless Haven provide additional ways to boost the power of the creatures and close out the game efficiently.
